SafetyInspectionBy: Iowa Department of Agriculture & Land Stewardship

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION OR AN EMERGENCY CONTACT: RYAN RICHIE, LOCATION MANAGER Telephone 712-583-3214.

I. THE FACILITY POLICY

   A. THE OWNER, MANAGEMENT, AND EMPLOYEES OF CROPMATE CO, COIN,  IOWA ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, LEPC, OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND TO MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE ON PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

II. FACILITY INFORMATION

   A. THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FOR SALE TO FARMERS.

   B. ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR APPLICATION ON CROPS AS FERTILIZER NUTRIENT.

   C. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED WOULD BE WOULD BE 341,445 POUNDS. NURSE TANKS WOULD CONTAIN 236,385 POUNDS AND 105,060 POUNDS IN TWO 12,000 GALLON STORAGE TANKS. *NOTE: MAXIMUM QUANTITY ALLOWED TO BE STORED IS 85% OF TANK SIZE.

III. THE ACIDENTAL RELEASE, PREVENTION PROGRAM
   A. THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF THE SAFEY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1, PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE INC. 

   B. THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111, STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

IV. THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

   A. THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATH, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY, NOR HAVE RESULTED IN OFF SITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE. 

V. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

  A. THE FACILITY HAS A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD 29 CFR 1910.38. IN THE CASE OF AN UNCONTROLED RELEASE, LOCATION PERSONNEL WOULD NOTIFY AUTHORITIES AND EVACUATE. EMPLOYEES HAVE REVIE

WED THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM  INCLUDING PRE-EMERGENCY PLANNING AND EMPLOYEE TRAINING.

  B. THE FACILITY HAS PROVIDED TO THE STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITES, THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA).

  C. THE LOCATION IS INCLUDED IN THE COMMUNITY EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN. 

VI. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

   A. SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY. PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS AND EVALUATE EMPLOYEE TRAINING. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON THESE EVALUATIONS AND ANY RESULTING CHANGES ARE AVAILABLE AT THE FACILITY.
